thread.title: Investigation after child kicked in head and chest by man on train | Central
thread.title_full: Investigation after child kicked in head and chest by man on train | Central - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Investigation after child kicked in head and chest by man on train | Central
text:
The attack happened on the Edinburgh Waverley to Peterborough train. Credit: Bing An investigation has been launched after a young child was kicked in the head and chest on a train by a man.
The attack happened on February 12 on the 4pm service between Edinburgh Waverley and Peterborough, just before the train left the station.
A man was travelling with three children and was seen by another passenger assaulting one of them, police said.
Officers say the child, who was described as being two or three-years-old was hit three times and kicked in the head and chest.
The man is described as white, of a large build and with short dark hair. He was wearing glasses, dark jeans and white Nike trainers.
He got off the train with the three children at Alnmouth station in Northumberland.
PC Joss Froggatt said: "I would like to speak to anyone who was on board this service who may have seen or heard the incident.
"It is unclear at this stage exactly what took place but we have had serious allegations made, so we are investigating to establish what happened."
Last updated Fri 17 Feb 2017 Travel East Midlands Peterborough
